Authors:
Tatsuya Hayashi, Yoshihiro Tanimura, Matthew Lee
Julius
Title:
Morphological and Systematics of Cyclostephanos species
(Bacillariophyta) recorded in Middle Pleistocene sediments of the
Paleo-Kathmandu Lake, Nepal
Abstract:
Intraspecific morphological variations in three
polymorphic Cyclostephanos species were observed using Middle
Pleistocene sediments of Paleo-Kathmandu Lake, Nepal. Cyclostephanos sp.
1 is characterized by five morpholoigical features that vary with valve
size. These include number of valve face areolae, number of mantle
areolae, number of costae, number of mantle fultoportulae and shape of
costae in the mantle. Cyclostephanos sp. 2 and C. sp. 3 are discussed
using six valve size-related morphological features: number of valve
face areolae, number of mantle areolae, number of costae, number of
central fultoportulae, number of mantle fultoportulae and internal shape
of the rimoportula. Cyclostephanos sp. 2 differs from C. sp. 3 in
possessing a larger number of central and mantle fultoportulae. We found
that in Cyclostephanos sp. 1, stratigraphically associated variations in
morphology occur in the number of costae and mantle fultoportulae on a
time scale of tens of thousands of years. The number and shape of costae
and the presence or absence of thickened structures (e.g.Â annulus) are
frequently used to delineate Cyclostephanos species. Our analysis
demonstrates the necessity for careful observation of intraspecific
morphological variations. To further clarify which features are useful
in species diagnosis a cladogram is presented including thirteen
Cyclostephanos taxa. Morhphological features included in the cladograms
construction identify a number of potentially useful features that are
not widely utilized in taxonomic and morphological investigations of the
genus.
